O Bystander effect: the idea that the more witnesses there are to an emergency, the less likely any one of them is to offer help o Diffusion of responsibility: the idea that responsibility for taking action is diffused across all the people witnessing the event o Pluralistic ignorance: we use the behavior of others to help us determine whether a situation is an emergency requiring our help; if no one is helping, we may conclude that help is not needed
